content.name: Managing The Documents Library In A Web Browser
content.detail_text:
Creating a Folder

Perform the following operations to create a folder:

  • Open Common Documents page (Documents > Common documents).
  • Click Create Folder on the context toolbar:

  • The new folder creation form will open:

  • Enter the name of a new folder in the Name field. Click Save.
  • After the page is refreshed, a new folder will appear in the table of elements.

Deleting folders

Perform the following actions to remove a folder:

  • Click Actions in the row showing the folder you want to delete.
  • Select Delete in the drop-down list:

  • The system will ask that you confirm the deletion and only then delete the folder and its child elements.

Batch Document Upload

To upload multiple documents to a folder, follow the steps below:

  • Open the folder to which you want to upload the documents.
  • Click Upload on the context toolbar:

  • The file upload form will open:

    This form serves as a batch document upload front-end. The procedure of uploading individual files from different folders is described below.
  • Using the file browser in the left part of the form, open the folder containing documents you want to upload. The right pane will show the documents existing in this folder.
  • Select the documents you want to upload by checking the appropriate boxes.
  • Click Upload. The file upload procedure will start; the progress bar will show the status of uploading the data:

  • When the upload completes, the file list will show that the files have been published:

Uploading Documents From Different Sources

To upload multiple documents that are in different folders, do the following:

  • Click Upload on the context toolbar:

  • Open a file upload form by clicking the link Show Form:

  • Select the files you wish to upload by clicking Browse. By default, four upload fields are available. The administrator can configure the number of fields.
  • If you want to update all existing documents, enable the Overwrite existing file(s) option. Otherwise, the system will warn you about existing files.
  • Click Upload. When the upload completes, the file list will show:

    Note! The Apply button allows you to upload files and stay on the upload page without switching to the file list.

Deleting Documents

To delete a document, follow the steps below:

  • Click Actions in the row showing the document to be deleted.
  • Select Delete in the action menu:

  • The system will ask that you confirm the deletion and only then delete the document.

Editing documents

To edit a document, carry out the following actions:

  • Click Actions in the row showing the document and select Modify:

  • A new form will open in which you can alter the document properties:

  • If you want to edit the document, download it by clicking the link with its name, edit the document and supply the path to the modified document by clicking Browse....
  • Click Save.

Editing Documents Using Microsoft Office

If you want to edit documents in Microsoft Office, you should have it installed on your machine.

The documents can only be edited in MS Office using Internet Explorer.

Note! If you edit Microsoft Office documents in other web browsers, your changes will not be saved!
  • With Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint documents, just click the document name.
  • Click OK in the warning window:

  • This will run a Microsoft Office application matching the file type.
  • Edit the document as desired. Save it and close the application.
  • Modifications will be saved to the server Library.
Warning. The document remains locked for other users while you are editing it. Do not forget to unlock it by clicking Actions and selecting Unlock:

The row showing the document will light the lamp indicating the document status. The yellow means that you have locked the document, while the red means that another employee has locked it. The document remains locked for other users while you are editing it.
